bedroom_robot.setting: Robot can only touch objects within the range of gripper contact. The robot has two grippers and thus the robot can hold two objects at most simultaneously.

wardrobe.setting: This wardrobe has a manual door. Objects can be retrieved out of the wardrobe when the door of the wardrobe is in open state.

state_description.type: the type of the robot or object, e.g., robot, cube, table, etc.
state_description.position: the 3D position of the robot or object, e.g., [4.0, 6.0, -2.0]
state_description.size: the size of the robot or object, e.g., size of an apple is 0.1
state_description.gripper_content: the content in the grippers of the robot. It is a nested list that represents the affiliation relationship of objects. e.g., [], [['bowl']], [['fruit_tray',['apple']]]
state_description.setting: the role setting of the robot or object, e.g., 'Robot can only touch objects within the range of gripper contact.'
state_description.gripper_contact_range: the range of the robot gripper's contact, e.g., 0.5
state_description.door_state: the state of the wardrobe door, e.g., 'Open' or 'Closed'
state_description.content: the content in the corresponding object. It is a nested list that represents the affiliation relationship of objects. e.g., [], [['bowl']], [['fruit_tray',['apple']]]
state_description.material: the material of the object, e.g., 'Plastic' or 'Metal'
state_description.jacket_on_bed: whether the jacket is placed on the bed, e.g., True or False
state_description.sandals_near_bed: whether the sandals are near the bed, e.g., True or False
state_description.sandals_on_floor: whether the sandals on the floor, e.g., True or False
